com.eyro.cubeacon

Class Cubeacon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eyro.cubeacon.Cubeacon

  • public final class Cubeacon
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton class for managing Cubeacon SDK.
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Eyro Labs
    See Also:
    CBBootstrapRegion

      • setBackgroundPowerSaver

        public static void setBackgroundPowerSaver(boolean flag)
        Sets background power saver mode. If enabled, it can improve battery life by 60% by slowing down scanning beacons when your app is in the background.
        Parameters:
        flag - true to enable background power save
        See Also:
        setBackgroundMode(boolean)

      • setBackgroundMode

        public void setBackgroundMode(boolean backgroundMode)
        This method notifies the beacon service that the application is either moving to background mode or foreground mode. When in background mode, BluetoothLE scans to look for beacons are executed less frequently in order to save battery life. The specific scan rates for background and foreground operation are set by the defaults below, but may be customized.

        When ranging in the background, the time between updates will be much less frequent than in the foreground. Updates will come every time interval equal to the sum total of the BackgroundScanPeriod and the BackgroundBetweenScanPeriod.

        Parameters:
        backgroundMode - true indicates that app is in the background
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_FOREGROUND_SCAN_PERIOD, DEFAULT_FOREGROUND_BETWEEN_SCAN_PERIOD, DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_SCAN_PERIOD, DEFAULT_BACKGROUND_BETWEEN_SCAN_PERIOD, setForegroundScanPeriod(long), setForegroundIntervalScanPeriod(long), setBackgroundScanPeriod(long), setBackgroundIntervalScanPeriod(long)

      • setForegroundScanPeriod

        public void setForegroundScanPeriod(long p)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds of each Bluetooth LE scan cycle to look for beacons. This function is used to setup the period before calling connect(CBServiceListener) or when switching between background/foreground. To have it effect on an already running scan (when the next cycle starts), call updateScanPeriods()
        Parameters:
        p - The foreground period to set

      • setForegroundIntervalScanPeriod

        public void setForegroundIntervalScanPeriod(long p)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds between each Bluetooth LE scan cycle to look for beacons. This function is used to setup the period before calling connect(CBServiceListener) or when switching between background/foreground. To have it effect on an already running scan (when the next cycle starts), call updateScanPeriods()
        Parameters:
        p - The foreground interval to set

      • setBackgroundScanPeriod

        public void setBackgroundScanPeriod(long p)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds of each Bluetooth LE scan cycle to look for beacons. This function is used to setup the period before calling connect(CBServiceListener) or when switching between background/foreground. To have it effect on an already running scan (when the next cycle starts), call updateScanPeriods()
        Parameters:
        p - The background period to set

      • setBackgroundIntervalScanPeriod

        public void setBackgroundIntervalScanPeriod(long p)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds of each Bluetooth LE scan cycle to look for beacons. This function is used to setup the period before calling connect(CBServiceListener) or when switching between background/foreground. To have it effect on an already running scan (when the next cycle starts), call updateScanPeriods()
        Parameters:
        p - The background interval to set

      • updateScanPeriods

        public void updateScanPeriods()
                       throws android.os.RemoteException
        Updates an already running scan with scanPeriod/betweenScanPeriod according to Background/Foreground state. Change will take effect on the start of the next scan cycle.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.

      • setRegionExitPeriod

        public static void setRegionExitPeriod(long period)
        Set region exit period in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        period - The period when region exit

      • addMonitoringListener

        public void addMonitoringListener(CBMonitoringListener listener)

        Specifies an interface listener that should be called each time the BeaconService sees or stops seeing a CBRegion of beacons.

        Permits to register severals CBMonitoringListener objects.

        Unregister the listener using removeMonitoringListener(CBMonitoringListener)

        Parameters:
        listener - The monitoring listener interface to add
        See Also:
        CBMonitoringListener, startMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion), CBRegion

      • removeMonitoringListener

        public void removeMonitoringListener(CBMonitoringListener listener)
        Specifies a class to remove from the array of CBMonitoringListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The monitoring interface listener to remove
        See Also:
        CBMonitoringListener, startMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion), CBRegion

      • removeMonitoringListeners

        public void removeMonitoringListeners()
        Remove all registered monitoring listeners.

      • addRangingListener

        public void addRangingListener(CBRangingListener listener)

        Specifies an interface that should be called each time the BeaconService gets ranging data, which is nominally once per second when beacons are detected.

        Permits to register several CBRangingListener objects.

        The listener must be unregistered using removeRangingListener(CBRangingListener)
        Parameters:
        listener - The ranging interface listener to add
        See Also:
        CBRangingListener, startRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion), CBRegion

      • removeRangingListener

        public void removeRangingListener(CBRangingListener listener)
        Specifies an interface to remove from the array of CBRangingListener
        Parameters:
        listener - The ranging interface listener to remove
        See Also:
        CBRangingListener

      • removeRangingListeners

        public void removeRangingListeners()
        Remove all registered ranging listeners.

      • connect

        public void connect(CBServiceListener listener)
        Connect an Android Activity or Service to the BeaconService. The Activity or Service must implement the listener interface so that it can get a callback when the service is ready to use.
        Parameters:
        listener - the Activity or Service that will receive the callback when the service is ready.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(CBServiceListener listener)
        Disconnect an Android Activity or Service from the BeaconService. This should typically be called in the onDestroy() method.
        Parameters:
        listener - the Activity or Service that no longer needs to use the service.
        See Also:
        connect(CBServiceListener)

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(CBServiceListener listener)
        Check if the passed service listener is bound to the service.
        Parameters:
        listener - The service listener to check
        Returns:
        true is sercive already connected
        See Also:
        connect(CBServiceListener), disconnect(CBServiceListener)

      • startRangingBeaconsInRegion

        public void startRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion region)
                                 throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the BeaconService to start looking for beacons that match the passed CBRegion object, and providing updates on the estimated distance every seconds while beacons in the CBRegion are visible. Note that the Region's unique identifier must be retained to later call the stopRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion) method.
        Parameters:
        region - The region to start ranging
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.
        See Also:
        addRangingListener(CBRangingListener), stopRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion), CBRangingListener, CBRegion

      • stopRangingBeaconsInRegion

        public void stopRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion region)
                                throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the BeaconService to stop looking for beacons that match the passed CBRegion object.
        Parameters:
        region - The region to stop ranging
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.
        See Also:
        addRangingListener(CBRangingListener), startRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion), CBRangingListener, CBRegion

      • startRangingBeaconsInRegions

        public void startRangingBeaconsInRegions(java.util.List<CBRegion> regions)
                                  throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the BeaconService to start looking for beacons that match the passed list of CBRegion object, and providing updates on the estimated distance every seconds while beacons in the CBRegion are visible. Note that the Region's unique identifier must be retained to later call the stopRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion) method.
        Parameters:
        regions - The list of region to start ranging
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.
        See Also:
        addRangingListener(CBRangingListener), stopRangingBeaconsInRegion(CBRegion), CBRangingListener, CBRegion

      • startMonitoringForRegion

        public void startMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion region)
                              throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the BeaconService to start looking for beacons that match the passed CBRegion object. Note that the Region's unique identifier must be retained to later call the stopMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion) method.
        Parameters:
        region - The region to start monitoring
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.
        See Also:
        addMonitoringListener(CBMonitoringListener), stopMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion), CBMonitoringListener, CBRegion

      • stopMonitoringForRegion

        public void stopMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion region)
                             throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the BeaconService to stop looking for beacons that match the passed CBRegion object.
        Parameters:
        region - The region to stop monitoring
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.
        See Also:
        addMonitoringListener(CBMonitoringListener), startMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion), CBMonitoringListener, CBRegion

      • startMonitoringForRegions

        public void startMonitoringForRegions(java.util.List<CBRegion> regions)
                               throws android.os.RemoteException
        Tells the BeaconService to start looking for beacons that match the passed list of CBRegion object. Note that the Region's unique identifier must be retained to later call the stopMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion) method.
        Parameters:
        regions - The list of region to start monitoring
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException - If the Cubeacon is not connected to the service.
        See Also:
        addMonitoringListener(CBMonitoringListener), stopMonitoringForRegion(CBRegion), CBMonitoringListener, CBRegion
